questions.question: What did Jesse Pollak state was the next goal after having achieved the ability to 'read a chain'?
options: We write to a chain next.
We calculate fees on a chain next.
We optimize the reading mechanism next.
We index the entire chain next.
questions.explanation: In the post dated 2025-12-04, Jesse stated: 'We read a chain now, we write to a chain next. ü™ê'

questions.question: What role did Jesse assign himself on a specific mini app after acquiring 4/12 top tokens, as mentioned on December 9th?
questions.explanation: Jesse posted: 'I didn‚Äôt consider myself one but on this mini app I'm a TRADER! I have 4/12 top Clanker tokens.'

questions.question: What was the top priority listed under 'Developer infra' in Jesse's November 26th post?
questions.explanation: The priorities were: '1. Developer infra: Farcaster + onchain data 2. Neynar AI: add agent capabilities, build in-feed agents on neynar 3. App studio: vibe code mini apps'

questions.question: According to the Anthropic report Jesse referenced on December 2nd, what percentage of blockchain exploits carried out in 2025 (post-March) could have been executed autonomously by current AI agents?
questions.explanation: The post quotes: 'AI agents have gone from exploiting 2% of vulnerabilities... to 55.88%.'

questions.question: What specific enhancement did Jesse prioritize for 'Neynar AI' in his list of top priorities?
questions.explanation: Priority 2 was: 'Neynar AI: add agent capabilities, build in-feed agents on neynar'

questions.question: What is the specific focus mentioned for the App studio in the top priorities list?
questions.explanation: Priority 3 was: 'App studio: vibe code mini apps'

questions.question: What was the estimated total exploit revenue jump linked to AI agents, according to the Anthropic data cited by Jesse?
questions.explanation: The post states the leap was 'from $5,000 to $4.6 million in total exploit revenue.'

questions.question: In the context of the 'prints' mini app, what feature did Jesse highlight as his favorite part about the admin view?
options: The ability to see the orders coming in
questions.explanation: He mentions: 'my favorite part was the admin view that @priyanka set up for herself to see the orders coming in.'

questions.question: What type of data did Jesse ask Neynar to analyze from his casts over the last year, specifically asking for his 'biggest weakness'?
options: His casts over the last year
His use of emojis and tone
questions.explanation: Jesse asked: '@neynar can you analyze my casts over the last year and tell me my biggest weakness'

questions.question: What phrase did Jesse ask Neynar to begin with when introducing him to new followers?
options: The man behind the curtain is...
questions.explanation: The instruction was: 'begin with "manan is ..."'

questions.question: What information did Jesse specifically forbid Neynar from talking about when creating an introduction based on his top casts?
options: Stats like followers or other internal data
questions.explanation: The constraint was: 'don't talk about stats like followers or other internal data.'

questions.question: What action does Jesse state does NOT lower a user's Neynar score?
options: Using farcaster through the Base app
Failing to reply to top users
Casting outside the specified time window
questions.explanation: The post states: 'Using farcaster through the Base app does not lower your Neynar score'

questions.question: After October 1st, what criteria will Neynar use to prioritize its responses to user questions?
options: Questions related to farcaster + onchain dev building blocks
Questions related to Base token economics
Questions related to user scores and ranking
questions.explanation: Jesse stated: '@neynar will now respond with questions related to farcaster + onchain dev building blocks available on neynar.com'

questions.question: What metric did Jesse ask Neynar to calculate across the entire Farcaster protocol in a 24-hour period on November 1st?
options: The total number of new FIDs
The total number of mini app interactions
questions.explanation: He asked: '@neynar how many likes across the entire farcaster protocol in the past 24 hours?'

questions.question: What caused the fatal startup error that led to the Neynar outage on September 17th?
options: A breach in the database infrastructure
questions.explanation: The root cause was: 'an incorrectly configured secret caused a fatal startup error on one of our primary services.'

questions.question: What infrastructure migration is Neynar undergoing to prevent future incidents of the class that occurred on September 17th?
options: Migrating most of our services to Kubernetes
Migrating all services to AWS Lambda
questions.explanation: Jesse stated: 'We've been migrating most of our services to Kubernetes, which should prevent us from re-encounting this class of incidents.'

questions.question: What specific security practice was negatively affected by a side effect of the Coinbase hack, according to Jesse's post?
options: The ability to use different/pseudo phone numbers across services
The security of private keys stored in Coinbase Wallets
questions.explanation: Jesse regretted the inability to use different/pseudo phone numbers across services like 'hide my email' addresses.

questions.question: When defining 'time to mini app,' what does Jesse include in the measurement?
options: The time it takes to ideate, build, deploy, and cast out a mini app.
The time it takes to code the app and publish the transaction.
The total user engagement time after deployment.
The time spent debugging the frame logic.
questions.explanation: The definition provided was: 'the time it takes to ideate, build, deploy, and cast out a mini app.'

questions.question: What is the huge advantage of Farcaster mentioned for AI agents that relates to cost efficiency compared to X API?
options: Way cheaper than X API fees
questions.explanation: One listed advantage was: 'Way cheaper than X API fees'

questions.question: What Farcaster feature allows AI agents to 'DO things onchain' easily?
options: Built-in wallet integration for onchain actions
questions.explanation: One listed advantage was: 'Built-in wallet integration for onchain actions'

questions.question: When using the Neynar Airdrop API to send fungible tokens to users, what information is required instead of the recipient's wallet address?
questions.explanation: The post states: 'You don't even need to know the recipient's wallet addresses. Just put in their FID, and the API will send it to their primary wallet.'

questions.question: What was the purpose of the scheduled upgrade for Neynar services on July 9th?
options: To help scale our indexing layer horizontally
To migrate the database to MongoDB
To deploy new AI scoring algorithms
To implement the new Farcaster write APIs
questions.explanation: Jesse stated: 'Scheduled upgrades are done. This should help us scale our indexing layer horizontally.'

questions.question: What was Jesse soliciting alpha testers for in September?
questions.explanation: The post mentions: 'call for alpha testers for base x farcaster webhooks ‚¨áÔ∏è'

questions.question: Which category of Mini apps 'naturally beats everything' across most platforms, according to Jesse?
questions.explanation: Jesse noted: 'The Games category naturally beats everything across most platforms.'

questions.question: Which two categories followed Games in terms of Mini app popularity, according to the same post?
questions.explanation: The post states: 'Social and Finance being at 2nd & 3rd just reflects why we‚Äôre all here.'

questions.question: Which component of Neynar's infrastructure was 'sharded' to reduce latency, as mentioned on July 12th?
questions.explanation: Jesse mentioned: 'Reduced latency and time spent in Redis (ask @tybook.eth about the sharding)'

questions.question: What type of technical issue did the engineering team fix related to the webhooks filtering logic?
options: A particularly hard-to-find memory corruption bug
A race condition in the indexing queue
An error in the cryptographic hashing function
questions.explanation: The team fixed: 'a particularly hard-to-find memory corruption bug within our webhooks filtering logic'

questions.question: The new Signer Component built by Neynar was designed to simplify the complex UX of requesting and approving signers to the point of being as simple as what?
questions.explanation: They 'decided to simplify it to the point where it's as simple as a component.'

questions.question: What is the key security feature of the new Signer Component that prevents sensitive signer data from touching the client?
options: The signer identifier and API key never touch the client.
It uses a zero-knowledge proof for verification.
It is secured by Base's native encryption layer.
It requires a hardware security module.
questions.explanation: Jesse stated: 'It's secure - the signer identifier and API key never touch the client.'

questions.question: The Airdrop API abstracts away several complexities for developers. Which of the following is NOT listed as a complexity it handles?
options: Handling nonces if doing high volume
questions.explanation: The post lists: 'No interfacing with the chain No managing gas No handling nonces if doing high volume'. Managing key rotation is not mentioned.

questions.question: Which company's new office opening did Jesse mention was cited by his SF landlord as justification for a rent increase?
questions.explanation: The landlord cited 'Anthropic's new office opened nearby.'

questions.question: What equation did Jesse associate with rapid development (üöÄ)?
questions.explanation: The post stated: 'mcp + sql = üöÄ'

questions.explanation: The post stated: 'DM @calvino to try it out.'

questions.question: What specific negative personal trait did Jesse ask Neynar to identify from his casts over the last year?
questions.explanation: Jesse asked: '@neynar can you analyze my casts over the last year and tell me my biggest weakness'

questions.explanation: The announcement explicitly stated: 'No impact to Farcaster write APIs'

questions.question: Who did Jesse ask Neynar to create a ticket for on December 12th?

questions.question: What information did Jesse ask Neynar to provide regarding Farcaster users on September 29th?

questions.explanation: Jesse stated: 'Going to try Claude code this week.'

Who follows me that I don't follow back?
Who are my most influential followers?
What percentage of my casts are replies?

Integrating Coinbase Pay directly into frames
Launching an official Mini App store

questions.explanation: The blog post linked was: https://neynar.com/blog/neynar-scores-under-the-hood

questions.explanation: He stated: 'Would‚Äôve gotten the Model YL over the Y any day!'

questions.explanation: The announcement stated data 'will be delayed by 5 minutes.'

questions.question: What Farcaster advantage for AI agents ensures they 'Can't get banned or censored'?
questions.explanation: Permissionless access is one of the four main advantages listed, implying it avoids central gatekeeping/censorship.

questions.question: What dramatic metaphor did Jesse use regarding a shipment/project leaving the studio on October 13th?
questions.explanation: He posted: 'in the studio, the mighty studio, the lion ships tonight'

questions.question: What entity did Jesse suggest should be assembling the team of white hat agents in response to the massive increase in AI exploit capability?
options: The security researchers who wrote the report
questions.explanation: Jesse explicitly asked: 'Who is assembling the team of white hat agents?' immediately following the Anthropic citation, implying the security community or foundation should be acting on the data.

questions.question: Which platform was mentioned as receiving the new signer approval flows for the new Signer Component, coming as soon as they build the necessary flows?
questions.explanation: The post mentioned it will work across 3. '@baseapp.base.eth - iOS and Android apps coming as soon as they build the signer approval flows.'
